title: Budget 2018 documents confirm that there will be a Brexit 50p coin - Leicestershire Live
text:

A Brexit 50p coin will be released to mark the UK leaving the European Union, The Budget 2018 documents confirm.
The chancellor Philip Hammond delivered his Autumn Budget speech in the House of Commons yesterday as he promised to 'end austerity'.
And documents released alongside the speech have revealed that a Brexit coin will be issued to celebrate the UK's exit from the EU.
The coin is set to be released on March 29, 2019 - the day the UK leaves the EU. A Brexit 50p coin has been confirmed by Budget 2018 documents. (Image: Getty Images.)
It is proposed that the coin will have the Queen's head on one side of the coin and the phrase "friendship with all nations" on the reverse.
As the coin is due to have an image of the Queen on it, the 50p will have to be signed of by Her Majesty before entering circulation.
The Budget 2018 - 11 announcements that will affect people in Leicester
The coin is apparently being issued to send a positive message to the rest of the world and to celebrate a moment of British history.
But what do you think about the coin? Is it a good idea or is it just a bit random?
